p: Cannabisativine was the first cannabinaceous alkaloid to be fully identified. It was isolated in 1975 in Mississippi from the roots of a Mexican variant of Cannabis sativa [ 61]. See Figure 8 below. These alkaloids demonstrated antiparasitic, antipyretic, antiemetic, antitumor, diuretic and analgesic properties [ 62]. In a 2004 study, Kuethe and Comins were able to achieve total asymmetric synthesis of cannabisativine with a high degree of stereo control [ 63].
